DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE STATE OF ALASKA, DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION TO CONDUCT ACTIVITIES THAT ARE NOT ASSIGNABLE TO SPECIFIC SITES BUT WILL SUPPORT THE RECIPIENT'S RESPONSE PROGRAM UNDER THE COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND SUPERVISION; COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT AND CONTRACT ADMINISTRATION; FISCAL AND CONTRACT MANAGEMENT ACTIVITY; LEGAL ASSISTANCE, INCLUDING COST RECOVERY AND LITIGATION ACTIVITIES; AND ADMINISTRATIVE AND GENERAL CLERICAL/TECHNICAL SUPPORT.ACTIVITIES:NON-SITE-SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: POLICY DEVELOPMENT, TRAINING, MAINTENANCE/UPGRADES OF CALCULATOR TOOLS, PUBLIC OUTREACH, PARTICIPATION IN RESPONSE EXERCISES, AND PARTICIPATION IN LOCAL AND STATE EMERGENCY PLANNING GROUPS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: GUIDANCE DOCUMENTS, PARTICIPATION IN TRAININGS, COMMUNICATION PLANS, PARTICIPATION IN EXERCISES, AND PARTICIPATION IN EMERGENCY PLANNING GROUPS.  EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: A MORE SCIENTIFIC AND DEFENSIBLE PROCESS FOR DEVELOPING CLEAN UP LEVELS, BETTER TRAINED STAFF, BETTER INFORMED PUBLIC, BETTER EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS, AND A CLEANER, HEALTHIER ENVIRONMENT.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF ALASKA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO WEST VIRGINIA TO CONDUCT ACTIVITIES THAT ARE NOT ASSIGNABLE TO SPECIFIC SITES, BUT WILL SUPPORT THE RECIPIENT'S RESPONSE PROGRAM UNDER THE COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT.  ITS PURPOSE IS TO FUND MISSION CRITICAL WORK IN SUPPORT OF EPA FOR PROTECTION OF HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT.ACTIVITIES:NON-SITE SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES (CORE) INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO: PROCESSES FOR EMERGENCY RESPONSE ACTIONS; DEVELOPMENT OF LEGAL AUTHORITIES AND ENFORCEMENT SUPPORT; HIRING AND TRAINING STAFF; PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND SUPERVISION OF COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT AND CONTRACT ADMINISTRATION; FISCAL AND CONTRACT MANAGEMENT ACTIVITY; LEGAL ASSISTANCE, INCLUDING COST RECOVERY AND LITIGATION ACTIVITIES; AND, ADMINISTRATIVE AND GENERAL CLERICAL/TECHNICAL SUPPORT.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO: APPROXIMATELY FIFTEEN (15) TRAININGS, I.E., WEBINARS AND ON-SITE TRAINING FOR NEW HIRES AND EXISTING STAFF TO ENSURE SOUND DECISIONS; ATTENDING VARIOUS MEETINGS ON CERCLA ACTIVITIES FOR EFFICIENT DECISION-MAKING PROCESSES; SUBMITTING ANNUAL FUNDING PROJECTIONS TO SUPPORT EPA NEEDS ASSESSMENT; AND, SUBMITTING SEMI-ANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS IN COMPLIANCE WITH GRANT RECIPIENT REQUIREMENTS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE RESIDENTS OF WEST VIRGINIA.

THE PURPOSE OF THE CORE PROGRAM IS TO EFFECTIVELY IMPLEMENT THE STATUTORY REQUIREMENTS OF CERCLA SECTIONS 121(F) FOR STATE INVOLVEMENT.  THE PROGRAM PROVIDES FUNDS TO CONDUCT ACTIVITIES THAT ARE NOT ASSIGNABLE TO SPECIFIC SITES BUT SUPPORT A RECIPIENT'S SITE SPECIFIC RESPONSE PROGRAM.  THE WORK TO BE ACCOMPLISHED ADDRESSES STATE PROGRAM PLANNING MANAGEMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION; FISCAL AND CONTRACT MANAGEMENT; HEALTH AND SAFETY; ARARS AND ENFORCEMENT COORDINATION; COMMUNITY RELATIONS.

THE WORK TO BE ACCOMPLISHED ADDRESSES STATE PROGRAM PLANNING MANAGEMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION; ADMINISTRATION OF COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS; FISCAL AND CONTRACT MANAGEMENT; STAFF DEVELOPING AND TRAINING; QUALITY ASSURANCE, RISK ASSESSMENT AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT; CLERICAL ADMINISTRATIVE AND PROGRAM SUPPORT; ADMINISTRATIVE RECORDS DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE; COMMUNITY RELATIONS; COMPUTER SUPPORT; LEGAL ASSISTANCE, AND MAINTAINENCE AND ENHANCEMENT OF DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS ACTIVITIES THAT SUPPORT THE COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION AND LIABILITY ACT.  THE FUNDING IS IN THE OPERATING PLAN AND IS FOR MISSION CRITICAL WORK OF THE AGENCY TO ASSESS, INVESTIGATE, SELECT AND IMPLEMENT REMEDIES SO THAT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT ARE PROTECTED.

THE WORK TO BE ACCOMPLISHED ADDRESSES ESTABLISHING AND UPDATING PROCEDURES FOR EMERGENCY RESPONSE ACTIONS AND LONG-TERM REMEDIATION OF ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTH RISKS AT HAZARDOUS WASTE SITES; ESTABLISHING AND MAINTAINING PROVISIONS FOR SATISFYING ALL REQUIREMENTS AND ASSURANCES; RECRUITING, HIRING, ORIENTING AND TRAINING STAFF TO MANAGE PUBLICLY FUNDED CLEANUPS TO OVERSEE RESPONSIBLE PARTY CLEANUPS; CONDUCTING ACTIVITIES THAT SUPPORT EPA/RECIPIENT INTERACTION; CONDUCTING FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING, AND PROCUREMENT  ACTIVITIES; PROCURING AND MAINTAINING AN ELECTRONIC RECORDS STORAGE AND RETRIEVAL SYSTEM; AND PROVIDING LEGAL ADVICE/LEGAL SERVICES ON A NON-SITE SPECIFIC BASIS, AND ENHANCING THE CONTROLLED HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE ENFORCEMENT/FUND LEAD DIVISION'S TECHNICAL CAPABILITIES FOR PROVIDING OVERSIGHT OF OFF-SITE CONTAMINATION FROM VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM SITES.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT PROVIDES CORE GRANT FUNDING TO THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION (NJDEP) TO CONDUCT ACTIVITIES THAT ARE NOT ASSIGNABLE TO SPECIFIC SUPERFUND SITES, BUT WILL SUPPORT THE RECIPIENT'S SITE-SPECIFIC RESPONSE PROGRAM UNDER THE COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT (CERCLA). ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND SUPERVISION; COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT AND CONTRACT ADMINISTRATION; FISCAL AND CONTRACT MANAGEMENT ACTIVITY; LEGAL ASSISTANCE, INCLUDING COST RECOVERY AND LITIGATION ACTIVITIES; AND ADMINISTRATIVE AND GENERAL CLERICAL/TECHNICAL SUPPORT. THE SUPERFUND CORE PROGRAM AFFORDS NJDEP WITH OPPORTUNITIES TO RESEARCH AND REFINE CURRENT OPERATING PROCEDURES AND PROTOCOLS TO IMPROVE ITS CERCLA-RELATED PROGRAM FUNCTIONS. SPECIFICALLY, CORE PROGRAM SUPPORT WILL ENABLE NJDEP TO DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN A DATABASE TO SERVE AS THE PRIMARY SOURCE OF INFORMATION FOR PERIODIC REPORTING TO MEET CORE PROGRAM REQUIREMENTS, AS WELL AS UNDERTAKING REVISIONS TO IMPROVE TIMEKEEPING REQUIREMENTS SO THAT SITE-SPECIFIC AND ACTIVITY-SPECIFIC COST TRACKING WILL BE MORE RELIABLE AND MORE EASILY RETRIEVABLE FOR THE PURPOSES OF RECOVERING SUPERFUND SITE CLEANUP COSTS.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND SUPERVISION; COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT AND CONTRACT ADMINISTRATION; FISCAL AND CONTRACT MANAGEMENT ACTIVITY; LEGAL ASSISTANCE, INCLUDING COST RECOVERY AND LITIGATION ACTIVITIES; AND ADMINISTRATIVE AND GENERAL CLERICAL/TECHNICAL SUPPORT. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:FEDERAL FUNDING BEING REQUESTED VIA THIS GRANT AMENDMENT APPLICATION PACKAGE WILL PROMOTE DEP'S EFFORTS TO ENSURE EFFECTIVE AND TIMELY PARTICIPATION WITH EPA'S REGION 2 PROGRAMS, WHICH LIKEWISE COMPLEMENT NON-SITE SPECIFIC CERCLA FUNCTIONS. THE STATE CORE PROGRAM PROJECT MANAGER ACTS AS LIAISON ON NON-SITE-SPECIFIC MATTERS TO EPA REGION 2 REPRESENTATIVES. SENIOR MANAGEMENT WITHIN DEP RECOGNIZE THAT CORE PROGRAM FUNDING IS AN EFFICIENT SUPPLEMENT TO STATE FUNDS TO FOSTER AND PROMOTE THE OVERALL REMEDIATION PROCESSES THAT MUST BE IMPLEMENTED IN A CONSISTENT MANNER BY BOTH FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES. SINCE THE INITIAL CORE PROGRAM FUNDING, DEP HAS REFINED AND ENHANCED CERCLA-RELATED PROGRAM FUNCTIONS THROUGH A PROCESS THAT INCLUDES EVALUATION AND REVISING SPECIFIC ADMINISTRATIVE AND TECHNICAL PROCEDURES UNDERTAKEN AS PART OF CERCLA PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION. THIS EFFORT INCLUDES RECOMMENDING ADMINISTRATIVE REFORMS THAT IMPROVE STAFF EFFICIENCY. OTHER SUCH PROGRAMMATIC REFORMS INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, STRATEGIC PRIORITIZATION INITIATIVES AND HAZARDOUS WASTE MITIGATION STANDING OPERATING PROCEDURE REVISIONS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $112,500.00 TO THE MINNESOTA POLLUTION CONTROL AGENCY (MN PCA) FOR THE FISCAL YEAR 2023 CORE PROGRAM TO CONDUCT ACTIVITIES THAT ARE NOT ASSIGNABLE TO SPECIFIC SITES BUT WILL SUPPORT THE RECIPIENT'S RESPONSE PROGRAM UNDER THE COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT (CERCLA). THE RECIPIENT WILL PROVIDE A $12,500 MATCH TO THE FEDERAL SHARE UNDER THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT INCLUDE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND SUPERVISION; COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT AND CONTRACT ADMINISTRATION; FISCAL AND CONTRACT MANAGEMENT ACTIVITY; LEGAL ASSISTANCE INCLUDING COST RECOVERY AND LITIGATION ACTIVITIES. NON-SITE-SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE PROVIDING ADMINISTRATIVE/CLERICAL SUPPORT TO SUPERFUND PROGRAM STAFF IN AREAS SUCH AS PERSONNEL, BUDGET, INVENTORY, AND PROCUREMENT. THE RECIPIENT WILL ALSO PROVIDE GENERAL OFFICE ASSISTANCE IN MAINTAINING CENTRAL RECORDS AND DOCUMENTS, BOTH HARD COPY AND COMPUTERIZED.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE THE TIMELY COMPLETION OF PROJECT MANAGER REVIEWS; APPROVAL OF CONTRACT/GRANT EXPENDITURES; PREPARATION OF FINANCIAL STATUS REPORTS (FSRS) AS REQUIRED. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE EFFICIENT COORDINATION WITH PROJECT MANAGERS, PROGRAM MANAGERS, AND THE U.S. EPA TO ENSURE ACCURATE AND TIMELY GRANT CLOSEOUTS. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE THE 5.01 MILLION RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF MINNESOTA.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS SUPERFUND CORE PROVIDES FUNDING TO HELP FUND ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF AND STAFF TECHNICAL TRAINING AND SPECIAL PROJECTS. THIS TRAINING WILL INCLUDE SITE ASSESSMENT, SUPERFUND, AND NEEDED TECHNICAL CLASSES TO DEVELOP NEW STAFF WHO HAVE BEEN RECENTLY HIRED.

TO ENSURE ACCURATE AND TIMELY GRANT CLOSEOUTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL CONDUCT SUPERFUND CORE ACTIVITIES FROM APRIL 1, 2023, THROUGH MARCH 31, 2024. THE CORE FUNDING PROVIDES OVERSIGHT AND SUPPORT TO HELP THE SUPERFUND PROGRAM FUNCTION EFFECTIVELY UNDER THE COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT. THESE WORK ACTIVITIES SUPPORT THE ACHIEVEMENT OF EPA'S PROGRAM GOALS AND PRIORITIES.

ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED IN THIS AWARD INCLUDE: THE PREPARATION OF ROUTINE PROGRAM ASSESSMENTS; THE PREPARATION OF THE CORE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT (CA) APPLICATION; THE DEVELOPMENT OF NEW OR REVISED GUIDANCE DOCUMENTS; UPDATING THE QUALITY MANAGEMENT PLAN (QMP) AS NEEDED; AND REVISING ADMINISTRATIVE RULES TO INCLUDE NEW TECHNICAL AND POLICY RELATED INFORMATION.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF WISCONSIN. THIS PROJECT WILL FURTHER THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES ABILITIES FOR SITE ASSESSMENT AND FUTURE REMEDIAL ACTIONS IF NEEDED.

THIS AGREEMENT MAY FUND THE PARTICIPATION OF THE RECIPIENT IN ACTIVITIES INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE REVIEW OF REMEDIAL INVESTIGATION AND FEASIBILITY STUDIES, PROPOSED PLANS, AND RECORDS OF DECISION AT SUPERFUND SITES IN INDIANA WHEN THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) IS THE LEAD AGENCY FOR REMEDIAL ACTION.  THIS CAN ALSO INCLUDE REVIEW OF INFORMATION, ATTENDING SITE-RELATED MEETINGS AND PARTICIPATING IN FIVE-YEAR REVIEWS. NOTE THAT THE HEADER OF THIS AWARD CAPTIONS IT AS A GRANT AGREEMENT WHEREAS IT IS A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT. EPA IS IMPLEMENTING A NEW GRANT SYSTEM THAT WILL SOON BE UNDERGOING ENHANCEMENTS TO ALLOW FOR MORE ACCURATE DESCRIPTIONS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO ILLINOIS ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (IEPA) IN THE AMOUNT OF $112,500 TO CONDUCT ACTIVITIES THAT ARE NOT ASSIGNABLE TO SPECIFIC SITES, BUT WILL SUPPORT THE RECIPIENT'S RESPONSE PROGRAM UNDER THE COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND SUPERVISION; COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT AND CONTRACT ADMINISTRATION; FISCAL AND CONTRACT MANAGEMENT ACTIVITY; LEGAL ASSISTANCE, INCLUDING COST RECOVERY AND LITIGATION ACTIVITIES; AND ADMINISTRATIVE AND GENERAL CLERICAL/TECHNICAL SUPPORT. THE WORK TO BE ACCOMPLISHED IN THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT THE OVERALL MANAGEMENT OF IEPA BUREAU OF LAND PROGRAM INCLUDING ALL ADMINISTRATIVE NEEDS, FISCAL GRANT AND CONTRACT MANAGEMENT, REMEDIAL PROGRAM, DEVELOPMENT, INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY AND RECORDS MANAGEMENT. THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (IDEM) TO CONDUCT ACTIVITIES THAT ARE NOT ASSIGNABLE TO SPECIFIC SITES, BUT WILL SUPPORT THE RECIPIENTS RESPONSE PROGRAM UNDER THE COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT.  ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND SUPERVISION; COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT AND CONTRACT ADMINISTRATION; FISCAL AND CONTRACT MANAGEMENT ACTIVITY; LEGAL ASSISTANCE, INCLUDING COST RECOVERY AND LITIGATION ACTIVITIES; AND ADMINISTRATIVE AND GENERAL CLERICAL/TECHNICAL SUPPORT.

DESCRIPTION:
THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL CONDUCT SUPERFUND CORE ACTIVITIES FROM APRIL 1, 2022, THROUGH MARCH 31, 2023. THE CORE FUNDING PROVIDES OVERSIGHT AND SUPPORT TO HELP THE SUPERFUND PROGRAM FUNCTION EFFECTIVELY. THESE WORK ACTIVITIES SUPPORT THE ACHIEVEMENT OF EPA'S PROGRAM GOALS AND PRIORITIES.

ACTIVITIES:

THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED IN THIS AWARD INCLUDE: THE PREPARATION OF ROUTINE PROGRAM ASSESSMENTS; THE PREPARATION OF THE CORE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT (CA) APPLICATION; THE DEVELOPMENT OF NEW OR REVISED GUIDANCE DOCUMENTS; AND REVISING ADMINISTRATIVE RULES TO INCLUDE NEW TECHNICAL AND POLICY RELATED INFORMATION. 

OUTCOMES:
THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF WISCONSIN. THIS PROJECT WILL FURTHER THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES ABILITIES FOR SITE ASSESSMENT AND FUTURE REMEDIAL ACTIONS IF NEEDED. 


SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT ARE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF NEW HAMPSHIRE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE VERMONT DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION TO CONDUCT ACTIVITIES THAT ARE NOT ASSIGNABLE TO SPECIFIC SITES, BUT WILL SUPPORT THE RECIPIENT'S RESPONSE PROGRAM UNDER THE COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND SUPERVISION; COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT AND CONTRACT ADMINISTRATION; FISCAL AND CONTRACT MANAGEMENT ACTIVITY; LEGAL ASSISTANCE, INCLUDING COST RECOVERY AND LITIGATION ACTIVITIES; AND ADMINISTRATIVE AND GENERAL CLERICAL/TECHNICAL SUPPORT.ACTIVITIES:THE VERMONT DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION EXPECTS TO CONDUCT THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT: 1. TO COORDINATE WITH EPA ON ISSUES THAT INVOLVE THE CERCLA PROGRAM; 2. TO WORK ON BOTH SHORT TERM AND LONG TERM STRATEGIC PLANNING ON ISSUES AFFECTING THE CERCLA PROGRAM; 3. TO PROVIDE TRAINING TO PROGRAM STAFF REGARDING CERCLA REQUIREMENTS; 4. TO PROVIDE LEGAL ASSISTANCE RELATING TO THE IMPLEMENTATION OF CERCLA; 5. TO MANAGE THE CORE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT CONSISTENT WITH FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS; 6. TO PROVIDE ANY OTHER CERCLA-RELATED SUPPORT FOR ANY NON-SITE SPECIFIC ISSUE OR TASK.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE VERMONT DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION (DEC) IS APPLYING TO THE U.S. EPA FOR A CORE PROGRAM GRANT IN ORDER TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE GENERAL PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND SUPERVISION TO SUPPORT CERCLA ACTIVITIES IN THE STATE OF VERMONT. WHERE APPROPRIATE AND ALLOWABLE UNDER THIS COOPERATE AGREEMENT, THE VTDEC WILL CONSIDER USING SUSTAINABLE OPTIONS. THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT CONTRIBUTES TO THE ATTAINMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL RESULTS AS NOTED IN EPA'S STRATEGIC PLAN, BY SUPPORTING VERMONT'S ABILITY TO PARTICIPATE IN THE CERCLA PROGRAM AND BY ENABLING VERMONT TO LEAD OR PARTICIPATE IN SUPERFUND CLEANUPS AND TO CONSULT WITH EPA BEFORE, DURING OR AFTER SUPERFUND CLEANUP ACTIVITIES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT ARE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF VERMONT.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE MAINE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION TO CONDUCT ACTIVITIES THAT ARE NOT ASSIGNABLE TO SPECIFIC SITES, BUT WILL SUPPORT THE RECIPIENT'S RESPONSE PROGRAM UNDER THE COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND SUPERVISION; COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT AND CONTRACT ADMINISTRATION; FISCAL AND CONTRACT MANAGEMENT ACTIVITY; LEGAL ASSISTANCE, INCLUDING COST RECOVERY AND LITIGATION ACTIVITIES; AND ADMINISTRATIVE AND GENERAL CLERICAL/TECHNICAL SUPPORT.ACTIVITIES:1. DEVELOP, MAINTAIN, AND UPDATE A GENERAL PROGRAM THAT INCLUDES MANAGEMENT, SUPERVISION AND OTHER NECESSARY GENERAL PROGRAM ACTIVITIES THAT FACILITATE EFFECTIVE CERCLA ACTIVITIES IN THE STATE. 2. DEVELOP, MAINTAIN, AND UPDATE A PROGRAM THAT WILL ENSURE INTER-AGENCY COORDINATION ON ALL PHASES OF RESPONSE (PRE-REMEDIAL, REMEDIAL, EMERGENCY RESPONSE, AND ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITIES) NECESSARY TO DEVELOP AND SUSTAIN A CONCERTED AND CONSISTENT STATE EFFORT FOR IMPLEMENTING CERCLA ACTIVITIES. 3. MAINTAIN AND IMPROVE PROCEDURES FOR FISCAL AND CONTRACT MANAGEMENT. THIS WILL ENSURE THE COST-EFFECTIVENESS AND FINANCIAL INTEGRITY OF CERCLA RELATED PROCUREMENT AND EXPENDITURES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:1. SUPPORTS THE STATE'S PARTICIPATION IN THE CERCLA RESPONSE PROGRAM, WHICH RESULTS IN MORE SITES IDENTIFIED, CHARACTERIZED AND CLEANED UP. 2. INTER-AGENCY COORDINATION ON ALL PHASES OF CERCLA RESPONSE LEADS TO COST SAVINGS, BETTER INVESTIGATIONS, QUICKER CLEANUP OF SITES, AND MORE DURABLE REMEDIES. 3. IMPROVEMENTS TO ACCOUNTS, COST DOCUMENTATION AND PROCUREMENT PROCESSES, LEADING TO PRUDENT EXPENDITURES AND BETTER ADMINISTRATION OF CAS. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT ARE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF MAINE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE STATE OF OREGON, DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY TO CONDUCT ACTIVITIES THAT ARE NOT ASSIGNABLE TO SPECIFIC SITES BUT WILL SUPPORT THE RECIPIENT'S RESPONSE PROGRAM UNDER THE COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND SUPERVISION; COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT AND CONTRACT ADMINISTRATION; FISCAL AND CONTRACT MANAGEMENT ACTIVITY; LEGAL ASSISTANCE, INCLUDING COST RECOVERY AND LITIGATION ACTIVITIES; AND ADMINISTRATIVE AND GENERAL CLERICAL/TECHNICAL SUPPORT.ACTIVITIES:ANTICIPATED ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: PARTICIPATION IN WORK GROUPS, MANAGER CAPACITY BUILDING, GRANT MANAGEMENT AND REPORTING, PARTICIPATION IN OREGON EMERGENCY RESPONSE SYSTEM COUNCIL MEETINGS, PARTICIPATION IN STATE EMERGENCY RESPONSE COMMISSIONS, AND PARTICIPATION IN AT LEAST 4 TABLETOP EXERCISES RELATED TO OIL SPILL BY RAIL AND/OR NATURAL DISASTER RESPONSE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:  IDENTIFICATION OF PROGRAM NEEDS AND IMPROVEMENTS, BETTER TOOLS FOR COORDINATION AND INFORMATION FOR MANAGEMENT, CONSISTENT GRANT PERFORMANCE, HIGH QUALITY SCOPE OF WORK FOR GRANTS, TIMELY PROGRESS REPORTING, ESTABLISHING AND PROVIDING GUIDANCE TO LOCAL EMERGENCY PLANNING COMMITTEES, AND ADDITIONAL TRAINED PERSONNEL FOR SPECIFIC RESPONSE ROLES.

ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO: BETTER, MORE INFORMED DECISION-MAKING AT CLEANUP SITES AND SPILL SITES, STAKEHOLDERS HAVING CLEAR, CONSISTENT GUIDANCE FOR APPROACHING INVESTIGATIVE AND REMEDIAL ACTIONS,  CONTINUED SUPPORT FOR CERCLA AND THE NCP, BETTER EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS WITH EXPANDED CAPABILITIES. 

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF OREGON.
